page.title: 20THE SANDLINGS, TOURISM
page.content: The Sandlings is a spacious area of great beauty and variety. The Forestry Commission have a caravan and camping site at Tangham near Butley, ideal for families who enjoy the pleasure of ob- serving the forest's wildlife at first hand. It is remote from holiday crowds yet near the Suffolk Heritage Coast. Planes from the nearby airbases can, at times, disturb this tranquility. Suffolk Coastal District Council have built two picnic sites at Hollesley Common on the C340 road and a circular nature trail is planned linking the amenity areas. Members of the Youth Training Scheme have built a pond by an underground stream and a hide. This is on a deer run and Roe, Muntjac, and Fallow deer may be seen at the right time. This is popular with visitors and 6000 cars visited the site this year.
